title: Most Urbanized Nation
description: In 2024, Singapore achieved a 100% urban population, with all residents living in urban agglomerations of more than 1 million people.

title: Top Global Depositors
description: As of 2023, Singapore had 2,902 depositors per 1,000 adults, showcasing a highly banked population.

title: Exemplary Government Effectiveness
description: In 2023, Singapore ranked at the 100th percentile for government effectiveness, with a high estimate score of 2.32.

title: High Human Capital Index
description: In 2020, Singapore's Human Capital Index was 0.88, reflecting a strong investment in education and health.

title: Efficient Business Insolvency
description: In 2024, Singapore scored 89.69 on the B-READY Business Insolvency index, indicating robust regulations and operational efficiency.

title: Superior Statistical Performance
description: In 2023, Singapore achieved a perfect score of 100 in Pillar 2 of the Statistical Performance Indicators.

title: Advanced Logistics Infrastructure
description: In 2022, Singapore scored 4.6 for the quality of trade and transport-related infrastructure, leading globally.

title: High GDP per Capita
description: In 2023, Singapore's GDP per capita was $141,553, one of the highest globally.

title: Regulatory Quality Excellence
description: In 2023, Singapore achieved the 100th percentile in regulatory quality, with an estimate score of 2.31.

title: Universal Primary Education Enrollment
description: In 2017, Singapore had an adjusted net enrollment rate of 99.97% for primary school-age children.

title: Universal Sanitation Access
description: By 2022, 100% of Singapore's population had access to safely managed sanitation services.

title: Lowest Electric Power Transmission and Distribution Losses
description: In 2022, Singapore reported electric power transmission and distribution losses at just 0.30% of output, one of the lowest globally.

title: Minimal Arable Land Per Person
description: As of 2021, Singapore had only 0.0001 hectares of arable land per person, highlighting its limited agricultural capacity.

title: Low Foreign Direct Investment Net Inflow
description: In 2024, Singapore experienced a net outflow of foreign direct investment amounting to -$96.68 billion, indicating a significant capital movement out of the country.

title: High Political Stability
description: In 2023, Singapore's political stability was reflected in a low standard error of 0.21, suggesting a stable and secure environment.

title: Minimal Learning Poverty Among Female Children
description: In 2021, only 2.10% of female children in Singapore were below minimum reading proficiency at the end of primary school, adjusted for out-of-school children.

title: Negligible Primary School Age Children Out-of-School
description: In 2021, just 0.03% of primary school age children in Singapore were out-of-school, showcasing the country's commitment to education.

title: Short Duration of Secondary Education
description: As of 2023, Singapore's secondary education lasts only 4 years, which is shorter compared to many other countries.

title: Low Mortality Rate from Unintentional Poisoning
description: In 2021, Singapore had an exceptionally low mortality rate from unintentional poisoning, at 0.0001 per 100,000 population.

title: Minimal Employment in Agriculture
description: In 2023, only 0.09% of Singapore's total employment was in agriculture, reflecting the country's urban and industrial focus.

title: Low Tariff Rates on All Products
description: In 2022, Singapore maintained a simple mean tariff rate of 0.05% on all products, promoting free trade.

title: Low Intentional Homicide Rates
description: In 2021, Singapore recorded low intentional homicide rates, with 0.07 per 100,000 females and 0.13 per 100,000 males.
